page.title: 01Landscape(Gazetteer Entry)
page.content: The village of Seamer is situated some 7kms SW of Scarborough at the eastern end of the Vale of Pickering where the flat vale meets the gently sloping dip slope of Irton Moor.Seamer is an old settlement dating back to Pre-Roman times,for weapons of the Parisii have been excavated from local gravel pits. The church is the oldest building and parts of the chancel and nave have Norman characteristics.During the Middle Ages,Seamer was more important than Scarborough,so the Burghers of Scarborough suppressed the markets.To- day Seamer with it's neighbouring village of Irton,is still rural.It lies in a rich farming area,but has now attracted modern housing estates, with an urban expansion of council houses at Eastfield and private devel- opments at Crossgates and Seamer.The area lies on the main A64 York road.
